function: Display a centralized dashboard interface showing financial data from multiple companies with consolidated views and navigation.
static_description: The dashboard shows a header bar styled with teal (#008080) against a mint cream (#F5FFFA) background. Below is a grid layout featuring cards for each company, summary statistics panels, and quick links to reports. Cards include company logos, names, and key financial indicators like revenue and profit margin.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a company card navigates to that company’s detailed financial page.
Clicking on 'View Consolidated Report' loads the aggregated report view.
Clicking on ‘Compare Companies’ opens the cross-company comparison tool.

resource_dependency.databaseSchemaDefinition: CREATE TABLE companies (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), industry TEXT); CREATE TABLE financial_data (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, company_id INT REFERENCES companies(id), date DATE, revenue DECIMAL, expenses DECIMAL, profit DECIMAL);

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database and define schema for storing company and financial data.
static_description: The backend initializes a connection pool to PostgreSQL using provided environment variables. It sets up two tables: `companies` containing basic company info and `financial_data` holding time-series financial records linked via foreign key.

resource_dependency.userDatabaseSchema: CREATE TABLE users (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE, password_hash TEXT, role VARCHAR(50));

function: Provide secure login/logout mechanism and protect access to financial data based on user roles.
static_description: A login form appears when unauthenticated users try to access protected routes. After successful authentication, JWT tokens are issued and used for subsequent requests.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Login' submits credentials to the auth endpoint. On success, redirects to dashboard; otherwise, displays error message.
Clicking 'Logout' clears session token and redirects to login screen.

function: Allow administrators to manage company profiles through CRUD operations.
static_description: An administrative panel lists existing companies in a table format with columns for name, industry, and actions (edit/delete). A modal form allows adding new companies with fields such as name, industry, and contact email.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Add Company' opens an empty form modal for creating a new profile.
Clicking 'Edit' next to a company row pre-fills the form with current values.
Clicking 'Save' sends updated data to the server and refreshes the list.
Clicking 'Delete' prompts confirmation before removing the selected company.

function: Enable collection and storage of financial data either manually or via bulk file uploads per company.
static_description: Each company's detail page includes a tab labeled 'Upload Financial Data'. This section contains options for uploading files or entering data manually through a form with date, revenue, expense, and profit inputs.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Choose File' lets users select a supported file type (.csv/.xlsx) for upload.
Clicking 'Upload' processes the file and stores parsed data in the database.
Clicking 'Submit Manual Entry' validates input fields and saves the record.

function: Visualize financial metrics over time using interactive charts within the dashboard.
static_description: Within each company's financial view, there are chart containers showing revenue trends, expense breakdowns, and profitability ratios. These charts are rendered dynamically based on API responses.

interaction_and_states.description: Hovering over chart elements highlights corresponding data points and shows tooltips with exact figures.
Clicking legend items toggles visibility of respective datasets.
Dragging across the timeline zooms into selected date ranges.

function: Generate consolidated reports aggregating financial data across all registered companies.
static_description: The consolidated report view presents a summary table of total revenues, profits, and expenses across all companies during a chosen period. Visualizations include stacked bar graphs comparing contributions from different firms.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a date range updates the displayed report data accordingly.
Clicking 'Refresh Report' re-fetches latest data from backend.

function: Facilitate side-by-side comparison of key financial metrics between multiple companies.
static_description: Users can choose up to three companies from a dropdown menu and select which metrics they want to compare. Results appear in a responsive table with side-by-side values for each metric.

interaction_and_states.description: Adding a company adds another column to the comparison table.
Removing a company removes its column from the table.
Selecting/deselecting metrics filters rows shown in the table.

function: Allow browsing of granular financial data specific to one company.
static_description: Upon clicking a company card, this view displays detailed financial entries in tabular form along with trend visualizations. Filters allow narrowing down data by date range.

interaction_and_states.description: Changing filter dates reloads financial data for the selected period.
Scrolling reveals more historical data beyond initially loaded set.

function: Ensure all displayed financial data reflects most recent available information without relying on static mocks.
static_description: All financial dashboards automatically update periodically, fetching fresh data from backend endpoints without requiring manual reloads.

function: Apply consistent styling theme throughout the application using mint cream background and teal accents.
static_description: Entire UI adopts a cohesive color scheme where backgrounds use #F5FFFA and primary interactive elements (buttons, links, headers) utilize #008080.

function: Ensure optimal usability and readability across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
static_description: Dashboard layouts adapt fluidly depending on viewport size, rearranging components and adjusting font sizes for accessibility on smaller screens.

function: Support exporting generated reports in standard formats like PDF and CSV.
static_description: Each report view features export buttons styled with appropriate icons for PDF and CSV downloads.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Export as PDF' generates and downloads a formatted document version of the report.
Clicking 'Export as CSV' creates a spreadsheet-compatible file with raw data.

function: Enable efficient search and filtering mechanisms for navigating large volumes of financial data.
static_description: At the top of data listings, a search bar allows keyword queries alongside dropdown menus for applying advanced filters such as date ranges or numerical thresholds.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing into the search bar filters results in real-time.
Applying filters narrows down dataset according to specified criteria.

resource_dependency.concurrentStartupScript: concurrently "npm run dev --prefix client" "npm run dev --prefix server"
resource_dependency.installAllCommand: npm install && cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install

function: Configure development workflow scripts to simplify local setup and execution of both frontend and backend services together.
static_description: Root-level `package.json` defines custom commands `install:all` and `dev` to streamline dependency installation and simultaneous launch of full-stack application.
